page.title: 05A SCHOOL IN THE PEWSEY VALE
page.content: Education The School at Oare is a Church of England Controlled Junior and Infant School. It serves the whole area for children between 5-11 years. The school has, at present, 75 children and these are divided into three classes; the Infants aged 5-7 years, the lower Juniors aged 7-9 years and the upper Juniors aged 9-11 years. Children who live in the village itself generally walk to school,but those who come from farther afield are either brought in by a minibus or taxi,provided by the County Council, or are brought in Parents'cars. At the age of 11 years we have to leave this school and go to Secondary Education, either at Pewsey or St.John's, Marlborough Comprehensive. Pewsey School takes children aged 11-16 years and if you wish to attend
